import React, { Fragment } from 'react'; import Breadcrumb from '../common/breadcrumb'; import { Progress } from 'reactstrap'; const ProgressBar = () => { return (
Basic Progress Bars
Progress components are built with two HTML elements, some CSS to set the width, and a few attributes.
Small Progress Bars
Use .sm-progress-barclass to change progress size to small:
Large Progress Bars
Use .lg-progress-barclass to change progress size to large:
Custom Height Progress Bars
Set a height value on the .progress-bar, so if you change that value the outer .progress will automatically resize accordingly.
PROGRESS BARS WITH CURRENT VALUE LABELS
25% 1/2 You're almost there! You did it! Meh Wow! Cool 20% !!
Progress Bars Striped
Add .progress-bar-striped to any .progress-bar to apply a stripe via CSS gradient over the progress bar’s background color.
Progress Bars animated
The striped gradient can also be animated. Add .progress-bar-animated to .progress-bar to animate the stripes right to left via CSS3 animations.
Multiple bars / Stacked
With Labels
Meh Wow! 25% LOOK OUT!!
Stripes and Animations
Stripes Animated Stripes Plain
{/*

1 of 5

463 of 500
Various (40) of 55
5 15 10 10

); }; export default ProgressBar;
